issue.title: Discuss context propagation of FlowWithContext.statefulMapConcat

labels.name: 1 - triaged
labels.description: Tickets that are safe to pick up for contributing in terms of likeliness of being accepted

labels.name: discuss
labels.description: Tickets that need some discussion before proceeding. Not decided if it's a good idea.

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
Statefulness means that you want to carry over at least some bit of information about previous elements to one of the following elements. The currently implemented automatic context tracking however just ignores that fact. As @johanandren noted in https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/26312#issuecomment-459382336, for some usages the association seems somewhat wrong. In other cases, it might be just ok.

We could either remove that one from the XWithContext APIs or document our way out of it.

/cc @RayRoestenburg

issue.title: !str remove {Source,Flow}WithContext.statefulMapConcat, fixes #26330

labels.name: tested
labels.description: PR that was successfully built and tested by Jenkins

repository.name: akka-core
repository.description: A platform to build and run apps that are elastic, agile, and resilient. SDK, libraries, and hosted environments.

issue.body:
statefulMapConcat will by design confound processing of single elements.
However, in the WithContext APIs the user only has access to the elements
but not to the contexts so the association is likely to be wrong in the end.

So, for now, we follow our basic rule not to include potentially order-changing
operations in the WithContext APIs and remove statefulMapConcat. Users that
need something like that should drop to the regular tuple passing APIs and
manage context propagation manually.

Fixes #26330.

/cc @RayRoestenburg
